page.title: 01LANDSCAPE AND BUILDINGS
page.content: This is a predominately rural area with the medieval charter town of {Lostwithiel}which is situated on the west bank of the{River Fowey surrounded by richly wooded hills. The town has a population of approximately two thousand three hundred persons of the lower_middle socio_economic group. The town has a number of medieval buildings such as the{Church, Duchy Palace,}which contains the 13th. century{Stannery {Court; a Tudor Bridge,}the facade of the{Old Grammar School 1760 A.D. the{Guildhall and Edgecumbe House {c.1740. North St.}contains some private{Georgian}dwellings and the stone work of a{Tudor}window. The new building at the Milk Factory is considered by most people a monstrosity.
